summary: Allows for Imperial Dragon Armor; Light and Heavy variants of the armor worn by General Tullius to be created and improved at blacksmith forges and worktables respectively, with new stats. Also retextures existing Imperial gear to match with it more.
descriptionHtml:
Name: Imperial Upgrade - Better Imperial Gear
Version: 3.0
Date: 12/29/2011
Category: Armor
Author(s): Claw3000
Source: http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=4669 
Description
===========
Allows for Imperial Dragon Armor; Light and Heavy variants of the armor worn by General Tullius to be created and improved at blacksmith forges and worktables respectively, with new stats.  Also retextures existing Imperial gear to match with it more. 


Details
=======
After installing this mod, Imperial Dragon Armor can be forged at any forge or anvil if the character has the Steel Smithing perk. Imperial Dragon Armor comes in two variants;

Light;
- Requirements for crafting; 5 Leather Strips, 5 Gold Ingots, 3 Corundum Ingots and 1 Studded Imperial Armor.
-Requirements for improving; 1 Leather Strips, 1 Corundum Ingot

Heavy;
- Requirements for crafting; 5 Leather Strips, 5 Gold Ingots, 3 Corundum Ingots and 1 Imperial Armor
- Requirements for improving; 1 Corundum Ingot, 1 Steel Ingot

In addition, a number of textures are replaced to match the Imperial Dragon Armor:

Textures Currently Completed:
==========================

- Imperial Helmet (FormID: 13EDC)
- Imperial Boots (FormID: 136D6)
- Imperial Bracers (FormID: 136D4)
- Imperial Officer\'s Helmet (FormID: 136CF)

*To add any of these to your inventory via console, type in \"player.additem [FormID] 1\"

Textures To Be Completed:
=======================

- Imperial Legate\'s Helmet (The full-faced helmet, called Imperial Helmet in-game)
- Imperial Armor
- Studded Imperial Armor
- Steel Shin Boots and Steel Imperial Gauntlets, these will be added to the Imperial category and retextured.
- Imperial Shield
- Imperial Sword

*Please keep in mine that this is my first experience of retexturing items.

Known Issues
===========
- After seeing the items in-game, I believe the retextured items are too bright to match with the Imperial Dragon Armor. I\'m uploading anyway to get feedback on my general retexturing but I may edit them to make duller textures from now on.

Future Plans
 ==========
- Complete remaining textures.
- Once CK is out, make structured tiers. The originally textured items the lowest, retextured versions of them the medium and Imperial Dragon Armor the highest.
- upon accomplishing this, the mod should be pretty much completed.
 
Install
 =======
 1. Make sure you unistall previous version of the mod.
 2. Extract archive to your /Skyrim/Data folder.
 3. Start Skyrim Launcher, click \'Data Files\', place a checkmark beside the .esp file.
 
Uninstall
 =========
 1. Start Skyrim Launcher, click Data Files, uncheck the .esp file.
 2. Delete the .esp file from \\Skyrim\\Data\\
 3. Delete the following .dds files from textures/armor/imperial/m; boots.dds, gauntlets.dds, helmet.dds, helmetmedium.dds
 

Incompatibility
 ===============
 - Any mod that alters the stats of General Tullius\' Armor, the values of whichever mod is loaded last will take precedence.
 - Any mod that alters the textures of Imperial Boots, Imperial Bracers, Imperial Helmet and Imperial Officer\'s Helmet.

History
 =======
3.0, 29.12.2011 - Retextures of Imperial Boots, Bracers, Helmet and Officer\'s Helmet, Bug Fix for improving Light Dragon Armor.
2.0, 27.12.2011 - Renamed to Imperial Dragon Armor, added Light variants. 
1.0, 27.12.2011 - Initial release.
 
Contact
 =======
 You can find me on the official Elder Scrolls forums as \'Claw3000\'
 You can find me on TESNexus as \'Claw3000\'
 

Credits
 =======
 Thanks to Bethesda for creating Skyrim.
 Thanks to Dave Humphrey for creating SkyEdit.
 Thanks to LHammonds for the Readme Generator this file was based on.

Tools Used
==========
Readme Generator - http://HammondsLegacy.com/obmm/tools_readme_generator1.asp
SkyEdit - http://forums.bethsoft.com/topic/1321720-rel-skyedit-v003-alpha/
Gimp (with DDS Plugin) - http://www.gimp.org/

 Licensing/Legal
 ===============
You can do whatever you want with this mod but don\'t complain to me if it 
doesn\'t work or your PC blows up.
author: Claw3000
